name: Journalism++
description:
Cologne
The chapter in Cologne, Germany, opened shop in early November 2013. Founding partners are Cosmin Cabulea (Developer), Mirko Lorenz (Journalist/CEO) and Gregor Aisch (as a partner).

name: Journalism++
description: Berlin

name: Journalism++
description: Paris

name: Journalism++
description: Amsterdam

name: We Do Data
description: Best quality partner for dataviz & information design

name: Arte
description: Development of the web documentary "The counter-history of the Internets" and another one to come in 2014...

name: Journalism++
description: Stockholm

name: Wikileaks
description: Analysis and display of the information contained in the Kissinger Cables, close to 2 million documents from the State Department's archive.

name: LocalFocus
description: A news service for (regional) media organizations to make data driven news stories and interactive visualizations.

name: The Open Knowledge Foundation
description: A nonprofit organization that promotes open knowledge, including open content and open data.

title: Knight News Challenge Summer
description: A gathering of News Challenge winners from the past three years, organized by the Knight Foundation. Journalism++ was invited with the Open Knowledge Foundation team, winners in 2011 for the Spending Project.

title: INRIA Winter School
description: Journalism++ took part in the INRIA Winter School in Santiago, doing talks and workshops on the topic of data-driven journalism.

title: Consulting mission for the World Bank
description: Journalism++ did a consulting mission for the World Bank in Burkina Faso. Nicolas Kayser-Bril worked to assess the level of readiness of the Burkinabè government to start its own open data initiative.

title: DataBootcamp Malawi
description: Journalism++ took part in the dataBootcamp Malawi, where Nicolas Kayser-Bril acted as a trainer and mentor during the 3 days of the event.

title: Singapore Digital Journalism World conference
description: Journalism++ was at the Singapore Digital Journalism World conference, where Nicolas Kayser-Bril held 2 keynotes to an audience of over 70 Asian journalists.

title: 4M Machrek conference
description: Journalism++ was at the 4M Machrek conference, where Nicolas Kayser-Bril held a keynote on business models for content in front of over 40 journalists and entrepreneurs from the Middle East.

title: DataBootcamps
description: Journalism++'s Pierre Romera was with the World Bank Institute in Kathmandu to take part in the local edition of the dataBootcamps.

title: DDJ Workshop
description: We did a workshop about data-driven journalism with journalists from WDR. In just one week we created a special webpage with charts. The key goal was to be be quick - and to learn.

title: Training in Norway
description: Jens Finnäs from J++ Stockholm is helping Norwegian journalists to get started with data journalism in a project arranged by NXT Media.

title: J++ awarded at Media Hackday
description: Journalism++ won the Guardian API prize at the WAN-IFRA Media Hackday in Berlin with the platform Broken Promises.

title: We <3 Helsinki
description: Journalism++ Stockholm has done numerous trainings in and projects in Finland with partners such as Helsingin Sanomat, Yle and Hufvudstadsbladet. Journalism++ Paris were finalists in the Uutisraivaaja contest.

name: ABZV
description: ABZV supports the development of Datawrapper, the best open source data visualization software. We serve above 6 million chart views per month.

name: UNDP
description: Journalism++ did a week-long workshop with young activists and journalists as part of the Youth Sleuth program by UNDP.

name: Tamedia
description: Journalism++ trains Tamedia journalists of all backgrounds and makes them proficient in all things data.
